title: I have completed my final year in BDS. I’m confused between either to prepare for MDS to get a government seat or prepare for general GPSC to get job security. What should I do? - Quora

response.answer_text: Much depends on your financial position. If finances are not an issue , prepare with full devotion for MDS. Remember that you will continue to need financial support even while you are doing your MDS. MDS is desirable because these days the Patients also like to consult only those who are specialist. Moreever certain branches of work will require you to be an MDS rather than a simple BDS. If Finances are not very strong , join as a General Duty Medical Officer and then prepare for the MDS. But do not conclude your academic career with a simple BDS.

Having got into BDS, this question need not rise. You can’t treat that as just another degree. It may be difficult for you to get into MDS if there is a gap. So I feel it is a hard decision for you. There will also be some time lag to get a job which you consider secure. So give a careful thought and then decide. If your are going for a govt. job or for that matter any job, you may have to forget MDS. BDS would be like any other degree you can try for jobs which require a degree to be eligible.
